column4: If my computer seems to be slower than it were on windoes 98, and programs (even nautilus) take long time to boot, would you suggest me to change the desctop eviroment from Gnome to Xfce? anything else?
first try a 'sudo hdparm /dev/hda' and see if DMA is working
I have done it. how do I tell if it's working?
look at the line that says 'using_dma' and see if it says 'on' or 'off'
Ah, there. I didn't see it. it is using DMA. I'll look into switching then. For a while.
actually, I was thinking that maybe it was slow because DMA was disabled.
Hm.  How fast is your computer, out of curiosity?
well, that is odd.  I was using a P3 coppermine at 500 mhz and it worked fine with gnome.
is it, like, problematicly slow, or does it just take 10-15 seconds for things to start?
Oh, I didn't say it didn't work fine. I just wanna see if it can work Better.
maybe I'm just whiney for nothing.
Da.  Da.  Well, in my experience, the desktop environment doesn't affect much except RAM usage.  If you want a really minimal window manager though, I'd recommend ion.
It might or might not be faster, I haven't really used gnome in a long time
Ok. Thne Ithink I'll stick to gnome. No need to hassle.
Da.  Try the clearlooks theme.  It may or may not affect speed in any way.
